titleInfo.title: Letter, James A. Wallace in Clayton, Ala., to J.G.M. Ramsey in Charlotte, N.C. 1871 Apr. 22

mods.abstract: James A. Wallace wrote to J.G.M. Ramsey on April 22, 1871. He pointed out many printing errors in the Davidson Monthly in regards to articles he had submitted about Rev. H. J. Balch. He asked Ramsey to read the proofs of the latest article he had mailed. He stated the importance of facts and correct dates to future historians. He also planned to submit a paper to clear up some misprints about the Mecklenburg Declaration. He told some tales of a private nature that he said he had facts on. He mentioned he had familial anecdotes that had never been published.

subject.topic: Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884--Correspondence.
